Articles.Content:
Does anyone know what the rest of this message is on this drill? I'm guessing the word there is "contact" and it thinks the drill isn't reaching the ground. I thought it might also be "concentration" or something indicating there's no ore at this location (despite what my resource scan showed me).

![isVlp8r.png](http://i.imgur.com/isVlp8r.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-12T20:25:43Z" title="06/12/2015 08:25  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 12, 2015</time> by Kelderek**
Yup no ground contact. Next time just play it safe and place it as close to the ground as you can. Or just test at Kerbin on launchpad
That's what I guessed. And don't worry, this was just a hyperedit test and not the real thing anyway. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

In a pinch, you MAY have been able to raise your landing gear.

...and hope your engines didn't break ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

As this was just a test, I will just go back to the VAB and make the adjustment there. But the landing gear thing would probably work, those mammoth engines are pretty tough.

I was mostly just frustrated that the message on the drill was cut off and I couldn't figure out a way to make the entire message show up. I even tried turning on some debug settings in hopes that extra data on the tooltip window might expand its size, but that didn't help.
